text: Robert Ray Redfield Jr. (born July 10, 1951) is an American virologist. He was the Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, and Administrator of the Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry from March 2018 until January 2021. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:Living people Category:American physicians Category:Virologists Category:Scientists from Baltimore Category:Writers from Baltimore
title: Robert R. Redfield
